alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Claiborne, western Hancock, northern Grainger and southwestern Lee Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tazewell, or 7 miles north of Rutledge, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sneedville, Rutledge, New Tazewell, Tazewell, Lone Mountain, Howard Quarter, Thorn Hill, Evanston and Ewing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
